website_summaries.verdict: This travel crib isn't just incredibly light and easy to set up, it's also completely washable in case your little one makes a mess.
pros: The crib is everything a travel crib should be – simple, light, cleanable, and doesn't have all the extra bells and whistles you don't need on the go
The mattress is also soft and reinforced so most importantly your baby will sleep
cons: You will likely need an extra large suitcase to fit the crib
Some shorter parents struggled with the height of the sides

customer_reviews.title: I've bought three and still loving it!
customer_reviews.text: I have bought three of these cribs. The first was for visiting grandchildren at our home. It is now with my son and wife and their new baby in their TINY home in Tokyo. Needless to say the size works better for them than a standard sized crib. When my older daughter would come visit she would like that she could get into the crib with the baby since it actually sat on the ground. She didn't have to worry about breaking the bottom. The only possible negative is that when the baby is small some people have a hard time leaning down and picking up the baby. Overall it is a great travel crib.
customer_reviews.author: M. Wells

customer_reviews.title: There is no better travel crib
customer_reviews.text: If you're researching different travel cribs or pack-n-plays, just stop now and buy this one. We looked at them all, and this is just far superior. Worth the cost. Lightweight, great travel case (size of a large briefcase), easy to set up and break down, thicker mattress than most, shape that doesn't encourage baby to climb the walls, and finally -- the most important -- it is made entirely of mesh, so the risk of suffocation during sleeping is much reduced. We had a BabyBjorn cradle, and this is just like that in terms of the mesh wall materials. Baby squashes her face against the side to sleep and is just fine. Absolutely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed by this silly little design flaw that would be ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes, they're soft. Yes, they're the right dimensions to fit the Baby Bjorn travel crib. But if they really want to market these as the best/right sheets for it, they really need to add holes for the tabs to go through for connecting the mattress to the frame. You can still do it, but it makes the sheet bunch up a little which obviously is not what you want. Very disappointed by this silly little design flaw that would be so easy for them to fix, especially for the price!!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Horn

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality - Stains wash out easily!
customer_reviews.text: Review long overdue, since my tot is already 2. Purchased 2 of these fitted sheets because the quality is amazing. Stains wash out easily as well. Fits perfectly as expected since it is made for the Bjorn Travel Crib mattress. I have never tried another brand so I do not have other data points for comparison.
customer_reviews.author: goingBananas

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive, but high quality
customer_reviews.text: Basic pack and plays are under $100. This is nearly $300. The markup is clearly outrageous, but at least you get a quality, easy-as-can-be pack and play. It has a compact travel design, and took about 30 seconds to assemble without looking at the instructions. It is sturdy and I like that you can remove the fabric for washing. It's clearly a superior pack and play, I just think they are taking advantage of consumers as a result. I think $200 would be an adequate market, but I understand the current price reflect the economic reality of supply and demand. This is [probably] hands down the pack and play to buy.
customer_reviews.author: ZRreviews

customer_reviews.title: i immediately began a search for a taller than normal pack n play and this one was perfect. its taller than most PNPs and the op
customer_reviews.text: my daughter started climbing out of her graco pack n play at 18 months old while on vacation. i immediately began a search for a taller than normal pack n play and this one was perfect. its taller than most PNPs and the opening is narrower than the bottom so it makes it very difficult for them to get a leg up and over the side. she has no issues with the mattress that came with it. she's almost 2.5 now and we use it frequently when we travel. its also a lot lighter and easier to assemble than most PNPs.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Little Bed!!
customer_reviews.text: We just got back from our vacation in Hawaii and I bought this for my 18mths grandson before we left. He slept like an angel on it. The soft sides netting helped because he's a restless sleeper. Perfect fit for him and still have room for him to move around. The assembling is a breeze!! All in one package and nothing else to screw in. Just pop it like a tent. The travel pkg is nice and compact and can be carried on in the plane. We all love it for its compact and lightness. Highly recommend it if you're going to friends for the night or vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Abby

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: We bought this crib because we thought it'd be better (smaller and more efficient) for travel but shortly after, we realized that the Graco travel cribs are just as easy to use and, while a tiny bit bigger, they are much more comfortable. Both sets of grandparents have Graco cribs with a separate mattress and they have more support. I wish we didn't spend the money on this one. If you do decide that this is a must have, I would recommend purchasing a foam pad to put between the pad that is provided and the sheet. We've done this and it is not as hard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit!
customer_reviews.text: This sheet is a soft, great quality sheet and fits the little mattress perfectly. I would order a couple more in the event of changing needs!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Patriquin

customer_reviews.title: Quick Assembly & Light!
customer_reviews.text: I was debating between this one and the Lotus. I’m very happy with this travel crib. It is super light and opens up/ goes together so quickly and easily for use. I like that the mattress has more cushion than other options and baby has slept well in it, so far in three different locations. I was worried about putting the baby in it and having to bend to the floor but it hasn’t been a problem (I’m 5’4”). I think it is probably too big to carry on a flight but that didn’t bother me. I checked it and it held up well through travel.
customer_reviews.author: UVAJen

customer_reviews.title: Good for Travel - a pain to set up and take down. Folds up small though...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use at the other home in my nanny-share. I wanted a safe travel crib that I could also use on vacation. It's very complicated to set up and put away, but it does fold up small if you know how to do it. Also, really no other sheets fit great that I have found. I ended up just buying the BabyBjorn ones and they are sincerely overpriced AND they say not to tumble dry... what new mom has time to hang dry sheets for a portacrib? If I had to do it over again, I am not sure I'd buy this.... BUT - it does deliver in the sense that it is safe and folds up small...
customer_reviews.author: Jessica D

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, frustrating to use.
customer_reviews.text: The sheets aren’t made to easily use the strap/hook system that secures the mattress to the crib. The sheets needed a reinforced hole in each corner to thread the strap through but as it’s made, you have to fish for the strap by sticking your fingers in the tiny hole outside of the crib, push aside the sheet which is built to stay out so it doesn’t exactly cooperate, and fumble around blind for the strap to pull through the hole to secure the mattress to the crib.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P.

customer_reviews.title: Not great but best option out there.
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best travel crib. Safe, non toxic, easy to pack and put together. My only issue is the mattress. All travel cribs have thin and uncomfortable mattresses. You can make it a little better with a mattress cover. This mattress is still better than the competition but can't compete with the bed you're sleeping in while you are expecting your kid to sleep in this. Good for naps while traveling but we ended up bringing him into bed with us.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Dee

customer_reviews.title: So soft BABYBJORN fitted Sheet
customer_reviews.text: This sheet goes with the Travel Crib Light. The sheet is so buttery soft and it fits perfectly. I love the soft off white color. The price is right and the shipping is quick.
customer_reviews.author: Arlo

customer_reviews.title: Great light crib.
customer_reviews.text: Great baby crib! It is light and easy to fold and unfold. I washed the crib liner once and air dried, there was no discoloration or shrinkage. I was able to put the crib inside my luggage for an over night trip, it fit perfectly in my medium size luggage. I also like to bring the crib out to the backyard and have my baby play while my toddler plays in his sand box. You can carry the baby on one arm and the crib on the other. It is very expensive but worth it in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mirna

customer_reviews.title: Great travel crib with ALL mesh sides.
customer_reviews.text: What I love about this travel crib is that the mesh goes all the way down to the bottom. Other play pens and travel cribs have fabric at the bottom that isn’t breathable if baby presses his face against it. The mattress is on the softer side though I guess firm enough. It’s extremely easy to open and collapse, and carries nicely like a piece of luggage with a handle. My issue with this item is the legs. They slant outwards and everyone is constantly stubbing their toes and tripping over it. Also, I’m short and have a hard time reaching over to place or remove baby from crib.
customer_reviews.author: L. White

customer_reviews.title: it's a long way down to the floor
customer_reviews.text: I like this product a lot. Very sturdy and pleased with the quality and easy assembly. However after watching my parents struggle to place my baby into it, I've realized it's a long way down to the floor. It's also a long way down for me since I'm 5'10. This might work better for us when he is bigger and able to go into a sitting position. The lotus with the opening on the side might have been a better buy for me and would have saved me some money.
customer_reviews.author: GiGi

customer_reviews.title: Best investments we’ve done!
customer_reviews.text: We have a 1 year old baby and travel extensively. We waited to see if it made sense to have a travel crib and which would be the easiest to travel. We love our baby born! Our baby slept in it from day one, extremely easy to assemble, super light and practical to travel and we even use it at home for our baby’s day naps. Highly recommend this light weight, user friendly and comfortable crib for a baby.
customer_reviews.author: Juliana Van Waveren

customer_reviews.title: Nice once it’s up, but hard to assemble and put back down
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to be honest, I have only used this once. It is NOT as easy to set up as they say. Once I finally got the legs sturdy it did seem to be a good travel crib/play pen. My biggest problem came when it was time to fold it back up. I finally got the legs folded but I never could get it all together to fit in the bag?? I guess I just don’t understand it but it is frustrating, especially with a wiggly 1 year old trying to help!
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: I like it because it is so compact and well made ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it because it is so compact and well made (you can wash everything). On the other hand the bedding is very low so it challenges your back (especially when your baby weights more then 20lb) and the mattress is thin and not so comfy for an overnight (well, the baby will not tell you that but I actually lied on it for a few minutes and ended uncomfortable. I like it in general but these two things (baby comfort and my back comfort) make me a bit disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Mag

customer_reviews.title: Loving our travel crib
customer_reviews.text: Opens quick and effortless. Looks stunning! Closing is a bit more difficult as it's hard to wrap it just right - the legs tend to shuffle - and we could never do it so that it fits in the case as it originally was. Instead, we have to force the zipper around the top when packing it away as it remains 1" wider on the top vs the bottom. This works, but it does leave me puzzled as to how it fit in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: iplayfullout

customer_reviews.title: This was so easy to set up I couldn't believe it
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up I couldn't believe it. The pad to sleep on is great. It's so much smaller then a typical pack and play, but not too small. It's given us more room and open space. The only negative thing is a fitted sheet doesn't come with it and i don't know how I missed that. Not a huge deal, but for $200 you'd think they could add that. We are going to Miami and we tried to pack the crib in just a suit case and it fit with room to spare. Overall very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soo much better than other portable cribs!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly easy to set up, very light weight, and baby loves it! Compared to my arms reach cosleeper that is very counterintuitive to set up, and my traditional playard that is super heavy and bulky, this thing is a dream! Even my husband who regularly frowns upon my many kid and baby item purchases, albeit many!, was SUPER impressed by this portable crib. Traveling internationally or even close by when we've had to stay at a hotel for a wedding was SOO much easier with the crib! Setting it up and taking it down can easily be done by a single person with minimal effort! Truly a great design!
customer_reviews.author: Wellness Mama

customer_reviews.title: Probably useful for a toddler but impossible to use with a large baby
customer_reviews.text: We loved the idea of this when we got it and our friends with a 2 yo recommended it. However, it is proving impossible to use with our 20 pound 6 month old. It is so hard to get him down to the mattress. We can't fully support his body as we put him down and he gets upset and screams. If there are travel cribs with some sort of raised mattress or lower sides, go with that option. Get this one when you have a toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Safe. Easiest set up.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up and take down. I love that this is a travel crib and not a pack n play so I can feel comfortable with baby asleep on this mattress. However I'm 5ft and hve difficulty reachkngf in all the way to set the baby down gent!y. Also while of has a smaller footprint then some, we've stubbed our toes on the support pikes more than once because of the triangular desifn that has them sticking out more at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: easy breezy, super light, not ugly like most pack and plays!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, super light weight, very quick setup and breakdown. I appreciate the neutral, sleek design as well. My one wish is that there were some sort option for a bassinet or upper level attachment for younger babies. It is certainly a long way down to the floor when gently placing a 3-month-old in here who is already sleeping :-/ That being said, the ease of use and light weight were more important to me since you only use the bassinet for a few months anyways. We will get a lot of use out of this over the years!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it if portability important to you
customer_reviews.text: So light and portable! Very expensive, but I wanted the portability this offers. Also extremely easy to set up and break down, which wasn't why I bought it, but I appreciate it. The first time I travelled with this, we were loaded down with suitcases and the stroller, and it was light enough for someone to wheel a suitcase and carry this in the same hand. Also traveled with as checked luggage on its own. It's a 5 star product, but I gave 4 because it's so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan A.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent travel crib!
customer_reviews.text: This travel crib is incredible! I love the fact that it is machine washable, lightweight, super easy to set up/take down, and the mattress is so much more comfortable than other travel cribs! This was very intelligently made! The only downside is if you buy the crib sheets that are supposed to go with it, they are not dryer safe. That is a pain. I am going to try to get other sheets that fit.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Warblow

customer_reviews.title: Detailed pros/cons
customer_reviews.text: Overall great purchase and would recommend! Pros: - sleek lightweight - soft mattress which fits most standard travel crib sheets (I used the Kushies brand.) - higher quality materials than other travel cribs - easy to fold/assemble Cons: - more expensive - would be nice to have a zip feature (like the Lotus) since it’s fairly deep
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Easy to transport and unfold
customer_reviews.text: Have used this travel crib both at home and away. Our 7 month old took to it right away and sleeps soundly on the soft mattress. I also sleep soundly knowing that he is safe since he can't climb out (he is now 10 months) or hurt himself on the structure of the crib since the legs jut out far enough from the mesh siding. I can pop this open in less than 30 seconds and pack it away in the same amount of time! Easy breezy.
customer_reviews.author: VincentSR596

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I thought about buying another brand that was cheaper but didn't want to mess around with fit. Fits the Baby Bjorn travel crib perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Gbigs

customer_reviews.title: Mobile comfortable crib = well rested toddler
customer_reviews.text: We visited a hotel with our toddler, and paid extra for the rental crib which was tiny, stark white, and with a bad mattress. This led to an awful long weekend of sleep and we knew that we had to find a solution. We did some research and found this travel crib and its great. When we travel, we are able to pack in some of our toddler’s stuffed animals, small blanket, and mattress cover. Setup and take down is very easy. The shape of the crib creates a lightly shaded area with the crib. Our toddler is used to it, and sleeps soundly within it.
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Not comfy, more difficult to take down than other PnPs
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (2years old) hates sleeping in this thing. I can't blame her, the mattress pad is not very cushy. She would wake up screaming nightly. Also, put up and take down takes too much effort in comparison with other products on the market for much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: robert pushman

customer_reviews.title: No other sheets property fit the Bjorn Travel crib, ...
customer_reviews.text: No other sheets property fit the Bjorn Travel crib, this one fit perfectly. It's nothing fancy, but it does actually fit...
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: While this is a bit more expensive, it was worth every penny. We went for our first road trip with our baby at 2 months and she slept great! But why I think this is worth the extra money is the simplicity and quality of the product. I am not that great at building things, so being able to build and break this down in under 2 minutes is amazing. It’s also super light weight and really anyone can carry it. Would HIGHLY recommend for any new parent that is looking for convenience and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Dom P.

customer_reviews.title: Nice but hard to lay infant down if your are a shorter person.
customer_reviews.text: This is nice lightweight travel crib that is sure to last us through toddlerhood. My only complaint is that for a shorter person like myself, leaning over to lay down an infant is difficult because of the height of the crib. I startled my son awake a few times when trying to lay him down because I couldn’t reach all the way. A zipper down the middle would be a good addition. The Guava crib might be a better option in this case.
customer_reviews.author: Mairalg

customer_reviews.title: So easy!
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use! We have a pack-n-play, but hate to disassemble and reassemble. All you have to do with this is pop open the legs and attach the mattress. I was on the road last week and used it on three locations on three different nights for my three month old. Setup and packing was so easy! Only complaint is that the mattress sits on the floor so the baby is very low to pick up or lay down but that means there is no real weight limit. No biggie for me, but if back issues keep you from leaning low then it may pose a problem.
customer_reviews.author: JoDB

customer_reviews.title: Super easy, especially if you need to set it up fast
customer_reviews.text: This has been a lifesaver. We used it during a road trip and usually needed to set it up lightning fast. Super easy to handle when folded and it was pretty much “pull out of bag, throw on floor, insert mattress”. A few times I have struggled folding it but it hasn’t taken long to solve. The bag fits a sheet, a pair of travel blackout blinds and a wearable blanket.
customer_reviews.author: T.G.

customer_reviews.title: Compact light and easy baby gear
customer_reviews.text: Favorite pack n play. Had one for the older kids, left it in a hotel room on accident. 3rd baby came along a few years later and my husband requested this. Easy assembly, light and durable. Worth the $$ every time.
customer_reviews.author: VAMommy5633

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Crib On The Market!!!
customer_reviews.text: Prefect crib for travel! This crib was a God send for us as we traveled to the Abacos this summer and took our first RV trip with our infant son. We had him sleep in it for two nights before the first trip so he was fully adjusted. He slept in it perfectly every night on each trip. We were also able to use it in the airports as a small play yard. It is very light and we carried it on each flight. Reccomend also buying a sheet to go with it from an Amazon retailer. Not the same size as traditional play yards so you won't find one in stores. Very easy set up as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bugirl39

customer_reviews.title: Worth every dollar!
customer_reviews.text: For parents on the go, this is worth every dollar. Not only is it very light weight and compact compared to other travel cribs, it is very easy to put together and break apart. I did it by myself with a squirmy toddler on my hip the first time using it. It was also very easy to find affordable crib sheets compatible with the mattress size. I would recommend any new parent invest in this product.
customer_reviews.author: christina serra

customer_reviews.title: This one is nice and soft and stays in place
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why the travel crib doesn't come with this or why its so expensive, but no other sheet I can find fits the mattress. This one is nice and soft and stays in place.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Behrens

customer_reviews.title: Lux pack and play. Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my visiting niece. My sister-in-law said this was the Rolls Royce of pack and plays. It was very easy to open and store away. Great for travel and to store away for another visit.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Yoder

customer_reviews.title: The only pack & play to purchase
customer_reviews.text: Look no further, this is the only pack and play to purchase. It weighs next to nothing and assembles in a snap. Perfect for traveling (especially for our family traveling with twins/ two pack and plays). I have seen other versions and they are clunky, heavy, difficult to assemble and difficult to store. This product is well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: HW

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for travel. My infant son slept great in the bed. Very sturdy and not too hard to assemble and tear down. The carry case makes it pretty convenient to transport during travel.
customer_reviews.author: Pbrees

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with this product. Baby sleeps great in it. I was worried we would have a hard time getting her in and out (we are both 5'10") but it wasn't as hard as I thought it would be. Super easy and fast to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love it!! So light weight and perfect for travel or a toddler who just want to sleep in your room some nights! The mattress is very comfortable. Would definitely recommend if you travel a lot and your baby/toddler likes their own bed.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Baby Bjorn!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to go wrong with any Baby Bjorn products. The only minor complaint I have is that you have to get used to the metal legs because I have stepped on them with barefeet a number of times as I reach in to pick her up. But otherwise amazing. Folds small. Not too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: AnthroReader

customer_reviews.title: easy and looks good
customer_reviews.text: easy and looks good. my toddler slept in it for about a week comfortably. only complaint is that I have to bend over or crouch down to get to her level in it so not comfortable for me. Wish it really had a zipper side like the competitor.
customer_reviews.author: Sehee

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and convenient
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly easy to set up and take down! I love that this has a thicker, more comfortable mattress than our old "pack and play" crib, yet it's somehow lighter and more compact to carry. I hesitated because of the price, but it was totally worth it for us to have our 17-month-old sleep comfortably in it for a week on our recent vacation. She is very big/tall for her age (more like a 2 year old) and she had plenty of room in this crib. She liked it so much that she actually asked to be put in it to play during the day a few times!
customer_reviews.author: A reader

customer_reviews.title: Not for short people
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work for people shorter than 5'5'' (which is my whole family). Ended up buying a new one bc there is no way to put baby in it without waking him up. Even my husband who is much taller doesn't like it. We also keep hitting the base while trying to go away from the crib which always ends up waking up baby. Ended up buying the Guava Lotus model instead which I should have done from the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Niska

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: We have used this for a few years now on trips or for guests with babies and also camping and it's held up so well. It's also washable which is handy. I love how I can even fit it into a large suitcase or I can check it as luggage when we travel. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lise

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome Travel Crib, can only recommend!
customer_reviews.text: We are really happy with our choice. It’s easy to take with you and comes with its own bag that is made well as well. Super light weight and low profile when folded.
customer_reviews.author: MrTookies

customer_reviews.title: So worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried my baby who had been sleeping in a crib her own room for the last 4 months would not sleep well on our trip requiring her to sleep in our room. I was too worried that the pack n play would be much too hard so I decided to splurge on this travel crib at a friend’s suggestion. We have used this a handful of times now and my baby has slept amazingly well in it. She has no problems at all, and it is a snap to set up and take down. It’s so light and compact. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Morcos

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put together and lightweight. Both kids slept in it with no problems (not at the same time). Big enough for the almost 2 year old with room to grow, yet still easy to put the baby down. I'm only 5'5" and can reach the bottom fine to put baby in and take out. So much easier to bring around than a heavy pack and play.
customer_reviews.author: MEL

customer_reviews.title: Great sheet for price!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality sheet. Very soft and stretchy material. Looks like it will hold up for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money! Our son stays sound asleep in this travel crib. It’s super easy to set up and take down. We have had no issues with it so far! I do recommend setting it up on a rug or carpet. That will ensure that there is a flat and comfortable surface for baby.
customer_reviews.author: MaizeNBlue

customer_reviews.title: Best $$$ spent bc Baby sleeps on vacation!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this crib. Easy to set up and take down. My baby was terrified of hotel rooms. We know she likes routine so we thought buying a bed that would stay consistent during our travels might help. It definitely did!! She goes to bed no problem now, just like at home.
customer_reviews.author: A Prime Addict

customer_reviews.title: Why didn’t I buy this sooner?!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried that our almost 2 year old would reject sleeping in the pack n play when traveling, but she wasn’t yet ready for a toddler bed. She slept beautifully in this pack n play. I so wish we’d purchased it when she was a baby! The soft mattress really helps I think .
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Peebles

customer_reviews.title: Softer and easier than others
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this to keep at grandma and grandpas house and are so glad we did. It is very light, very easy to set up and has a softer mattress than others we have seen. Since the mattress sits right on the floor it doesn't have to be as hard as a gym mat to hold shape, it feels more like her crib mattress. My daughter had no transition issues with this crib, slept like she does at home
customer_reviews.author: Reading Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny for us since we recently did a ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth every penny for us since we recently did a lot of traveling and transitioning with our son from 18 months onward. He's now 2 and I have him sleeping in it in his room since he likes it more than his crib now and will keep him in it until he's ready for a big boy bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice travel crib.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice travel crib. Setting it up and breaking it down is straightforward and easy enough. The dimensions when folded mean it won't fit in your luggage (unless you maybe have the biggest suitcase ever made), so you need to pay to put it in checked luggage on the plane. In some airports it comes out in "oversized baggage" (though it's not really that big), so look there when you don't see it with the rest of your checked luggage.
customer_reviews.author: James Byrum

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time on ANY OTHER CRIB. THIS IS THE ONE!
customer_reviews.text: The best thing I have bought for my Baby has travelled with us to Europe and Asia. At home its a safe place for him to play in. On our travels its been absolutely the easiest thing to put together and pack away again Its perfect to prevent crawlers from getting into trouble specially in new surroundings. Don't buy anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Zainab Jabbar

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: Love this travel crib! We had a graco packnplay before our house burned down. We replaced it with this product and have loved it. Our 1.5 year old slept in it for a solid 2 months while we were in transition to find a new home and he didn't seem to mind at all. I love how compact it is--small footprint in the room, is light and travels easily. It is also really simple to set up and put away.
customer_reviews.author: Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up and take down
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding travel crib. Easy to put up and take down, and it folds into a nice compact bag. Our little one sleeps great in there, and we feel good about the mesh sides being breathable and allowing fresh air to flow through. Strongly recommend this travel crib.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, Sturdy, Good looking travel crib
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when my baby was around 6 months old. Intended to use for domestic trips. This summer we took it with us for a vacation abroad, and I finally realized how great this travel crib is! It is very easy to install and uninstall. Very sturdy, we checked it in as regular luggage, and there was no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu Lu

customer_reviews.title: Compact and great for travel, price is way too much
customer_reviews.text: Pros: light weight, relatively easy setup (same as most pack and plays in my opinion), prefer this setup for travel. Cons: Paying for the brand name, not sold on quality for the cost, ours didn't even come with a sheet, $200 and you can't throw in a fitted sheet?
customer_reviews.author: Dad

customer_reviews.title: Not for shorties!
customer_reviews.text: Great design and awesome product but just too tall for me. I'm right around 5' and was unable to comfortably and safely place my child in and take him out. Returned and ordered the Lotus which has one side that zips open. I still highly recommend Babybjorn products.
customer_reviews.author: Becbee

customer_reviews.title: We were out of country for 2 months, and ...
customer_reviews.text: We were out of country for 2 months,and we used this everyday for my son. The only reason I gave 4 stars is the dimensions of it. Even it is not so heavy, it is reaaly wide. You have to have a huugeee luggage
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: This is the best portable crib around
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for when my grandkids come to visit. Well after the first visit I have none. Both of my sons and daughter-in-laws loved them so much they each took one home!! These are not cheap but according to them, they beat any pack-n-play on the market. They absolutely loved them!
customer_reviews.author: CyndiB

customer_reviews.title: So Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: In love with this Travel Crib! We've now used this on 4 trips, 3 of which I was traveling solo with our sub 1-year old. The fact that this crib is so lightweight, easy to assemble and fold up, is huge! To me, it is worth every penny and I strongly recommend this option to anyone that is traveling or will be folding/unfolding the play pen often.
customer_reviews.author: Celia Telesco

customer_reviews.title: I do really like the size that it breaks down into--it fits perfectly ...
customer_reviews.text: My son wakes up when we put him down in this at this point. We still have hope for future trips. I just really wish that it had a zipper so that I could lay beside him to get him to sleep. I do really like the size that it breaks down into--it fits perfectly in our Away (large) suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Soft sheet for travel crib!
customer_reviews.text: Super soft sheets that fit the travel crib well. Expensive but worth it- definitely softer than the sheet that comes with the crib.
customer_reviews.author: super limited

customer_reviews.title: BabyBjorn is the highest quality infant products
customer_reviews.text: BabyBjorn is the highest quality infant products. I purchased this as a gift to new parents and they were ecstatic as they knew they were getting the best. Very functional with safety in mind for your child. We have used these for years and refuse to use anything else because you really get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Priceless. Compact and easy to travel with. Mattress is about 4 times thicker than a normal travel crib and very comfortable. We have used this on three trips ranging from my son being just over a year to almost two years old. He happily naps and sleeps for us with no problems on the road and I love the peace of mind that he'll have a safe, clean, comfortable place to sleep every night.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa D

customer_reviews.title: I loved it. I did
customer_reviews.text: I loved it. I did. But ultimately went with the Lotus because of the backpack feature and because it could be carried on planes. Because of the short strap on the carry case I just found this difficult to carry while holding a baby and diaper bag. But the quality is excellent and if it weren't for the Lotus I would've kept ti.
customer_reviews.author: EmilySue

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculously light and easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this travel crib. It is ridiculously light and easy to set up. My only complaint (and it is small) is that, the first time I used it, I had a little difficulty figuring out how to fold the legs just so to put it back together. All you have to do is pull and bend, though, it's easy. We use this as a pack n' play and as the extra crib for our nanny share. I look forward to using this crib on the go! If all you want is a travel crib, without all the bells and whistles, this is what you need to get. It does not come with the crib sheet.
customer_reviews.author: hiodom

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Travel
customer_reviews.text: Probably the Best purchase we made as parents. We have travelled all over the world with this portable crib and it has held up nicely. Our daughter is now 2.5 and still sleeps in it with travels. After staying at hotels with questionable cribs this was our solution. We always check it through on flights and it has never been damaged. The sides are higher than the Graco cribs and the design has really dissuaded our daughter from wanting to get out! I also love that the mesh is washable!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Rosewater

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel bed!
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loves this bed! She took to it immediately and went right to sleep with no fuss. We have a 5 inch mattress for her pack n play (this is where she sleeps when we are home) and thought she might have a problem sleeping on the thin blow up mattress but we were wrong! She loves it and we are so please with our purchase. It fits right in our checked bag (we have also carried it on the plane) so it is perfect for people always on the go!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: and it was extremely easy to set up and take down
customer_reviews.text: Very convenient for traveling with our nine month old. He had no problems sleeping in the crib, and it was extremely easy to set up and take down. Also is a relatively convenient size and weight for checking with our bags at the airport. I would highly recommend this to anyone that needs to travel with a baby or toddler.
customer_reviews.author: Silva NYC

customer_reviews.title: So easy to set up! Love this crib!
customer_reviews.text: Great travel crib. Super light and uncomplicated. A bit deep so bending over to pick up baby can be hard on the back, but we feel safer with the full mesh. Note- mattress is practically on the floor- in the wintertime the floor can be drafty- be sure to dress baby appropriately.
customer_reviews.author: super limited

customer_reviews.title: We love this!
customer_reviews.text: So light and easy to travel and fly with. Comfy mattress. Easy to assemble and take down in a flash. Organic sheets that fit perfectly (dont dry them in the dryer!) What's not to LOVE!? We are so happy we bought this. Has made traveling very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: M. green

customer_reviews.title: it will be sitting on the ground and potentially getting dirty. Other portable cribs sit above the ground
customer_reviews.text: One thing I did not consider before buying this is that it sits on the ground. So if you take it outside or camping, etc, it will be sitting on the ground and potentially getting dirty. Other portable cribs sit above the ground, for what it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Hans Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Not for short people
customer_reviews.text: A nice product but not ideal for people around 5'1. It hurts my back a lot when I bend over to get my son in and out. But worth it for the security of knowing its chemical free.
customer_reviews.author: blue

customer_reviews.title: Moms love this
customer_reviews.text: This was given as a baby shower gift and the mom to be loved it. She said that she will get a lot of use out of it and she told me that it was her favorite gift at the shower and the most usable.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Great travel crib.
customer_reviews.text: Took this overseas twice already with out toddler. Our kid slept comfortably. We did need to get the mattress liner separately. Easy to carry around with luggage.
customer_reviews.author: John Efthimiopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Portable Crib
customer_reviews.text: Excellent portable crib. So easy to set up and the quality is of the materials is excellent. I would recommend this in comparison to the pack and play that I've used in the past. This is a much better product. Did not include a sheet with this order, I had to order the sheet's separate. Tried to find another sheet at local stores but couldn't find any. I would recommend ordering 2 sheets if you need. This crib folds up into a case for easy storage in a closet.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna D. Trier

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Christmas gift for my Daughter's grand child. The family loves it,
customer_reviews.author: John N. Bui

customer_reviews.title: Not ideal for a baby or non tall parents
customer_reviews.text: The quality is great but for my wife and I who aren't overly tall - she's 5'5 and I'm 5'8, it's a bit of a pain to bend over the railing for a baby. Perhaps for a toddler this is a better fit so we may just need to "grow" into it.
customer_reviews.author: Terence

customer_reviews.title: Genius design
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product! Used a regular pack n play for older two kids when they were babies 5 years ago and this is (obviously) miles above that. Now that this baby's 5 months and rolling around we use this every day in our living room to give her a safe place to play. I love that no matter where she is in the crib, her head is against something soft! #genius Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Alli P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bed!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to go in vacation. My some is not quite ready for a bed and this was perfect. Easy to assemble, light weight and the bag is convenient keeping the bed neat and organized.
customer_reviews.author: Kelee

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money!
customer_reviews.text: So worth the money! We have a little one but don't want to give up traveling. This is perfect for shorter trips but will also come in handy when we travel oversees later on. It is pricer than other pack-n-plays but it folds up so small. NOTE: It comes with a mattress but needs a sheet. We purchased one from Amazon for $17.
customer_reviews.author: lahuke

customer_reviews.title: quality and durability issues
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in lieu of traditional style pack n play. The mattress is not thick enough to absorb impact (falls) on hard wood floors; had to put extra padding underneath to ensure baby had safe place to play. The angled support posts take up considerably more room than traditional model.
customer_reviews.author: mer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!!!! Easy to open and close it And the most important for me when I traveling that it's very very light! The mattress it's very thick and Comfortable to compare another pack and play Worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: May

customer_reviews.title: A bit boujie but also fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter outgrew her pack n' play and we needed last minute travel crib. we ended up shelling the money for this based on friend recommendation. It ended up being a great investment. We used it often when we visit grandparents, friends and vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Eli

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy, compact
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to put up, no danger of finger pinching. Had to google how to take it down but was simple once I had done it once. Very compact when put away in it's carrying case. Light and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: kramalot

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Crib Around!!
customer_reviews.text: This Travel crib is so much better than a pack and play! We use it for our daughter's naps with her nanny share. We set it up and take it down daily, and it's a breeze to do so. Two things to note: 1. You can't raise the bed height like a pack and play. 2. The mattress is a funny size. So if you want a sheet that fits snugly, you'll need to buy Baby Bjorn's expensive one, or the knock-off on Amazon. We're using a regular crib sheet, tucked under, and it's been just fine.
customer_reviews.author: HSchneider

customer_reviews.title: Good for travel
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and easy to assemble, so it’s nice for travel. Difficult to lay baby down since the mattress is on the ground. Also found the shape to be a bit annoying — we always trip over/knock into the corners when walking around the room, especially in the dark. We also have the nuna pack n play, which we just leave at my moms house, and I much prefer that one for frequent use (but it’s very heavy).
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: This travel crib is amazing- so very easy to set up and so lightweight. I debated getting a cheaper travel crib/PNP but decided that with how easy the Bjorn is to use and travel with, I'll get much more use out of it. Just get it- you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Pollard

customer_reviews.title: and it's awesome. It travels well (we have checked it a ...
customer_reviews.text: We've used this crib a million times as we've traveled quite a bit with our baby, and it's awesome. It travels well (we have checked it a lot and it's held up great), it is quick to set up, and our baby sleeps in it great, so I assume the mattress is comfy. Love it and would recommend to anyone who travels with an infant.
customer_reviews.author: Megan W

product_meta.title: BABYBJORN Travel Crib Light - Silver
product_meta.description:
Style:Travel Crib Light| Color:SILVERBaby Bjorn Travel Light Crib - Silver Lightweight and portable, the newly re-designed BabyBjorn Travel Crib Light provides your baby a safe, comfortable space for sleep or play at home or on the road. Especially convenient for busy parents, the Travel Crib Light sets up in just seconds and features a plush, cozy mattress and a sturdy base that does not wobble. Sets up and is ready to use in one simple movement. Compact and lightweight design (11 pounds) makes it easy to take with you. Insulated mattress keeps baby warm and comfortable. Waterproof, breathable mattress cover is machine washable. Net fabric side panels make it easy to keep an eye on baby. Product Dimensions: 19 x 5.5 x 23.5 inches Weight: 11 pounds. Do not place product near window where cords from blinds or drapes can strangle a child. The Travel Crib complies with the EN 716 safety standard for folding cribs and national fire safety requirements.

BRAND STORY
By BabyBjorn
feature_bullets: Simple to set up and fold up
Removable and machine washable crib textiles

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars706 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
